required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevalence, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors of Intraabdominal Hypertension and Abdominal Compartment Syndrome in Critically Ill Surgical Patients in Ramathibodi Hospital
clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors of Intraabdominal Hypertension and Abdominal Compartment Syndrome in Critically Ill Surgical Patients in Ramathibodi Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: To identified prevalence, risk factors, and prognostic factors of IAH and ACS in surgical critically ill patients in institutional hospital

detailed_description.textblock: Every postoperative patients admitted to surgical ICU who meet inclusion criteria will be asked for informed consent. After obtained, intraabdominal pressure (IAP) will be measured through already placed Foley's catheter simultaneously with patients's data record. If patients don't have IAH or ICS, IAP will be measured daily until discharge from ICU or removal of Foley's catheter. If patients have IAH or ACS, IAP will be measured every 6-8 hours until IAP is less than 12 mmHg then it will be measures daily until discharge from ICU or removal of Foley's catheter. After completion of data collection, data will be analyzed accordingly.

primary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of intraabdominal hypertension and abdominal compartment syndrome
primary_outcome.description: Prevalence of intraabdominal hypertension and abdominal compartment syndrome

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk factors of intraabdominal hypertension and abdominal compartment syndrome
secondary_outcome.description: Risk factors of intraabdominal hypertension and abdominal compartment syndrome

secondary_outcome.measure: Prognostic factors of death after developing intraabdominal hypertension and abdominal compartment syndrome
secondary_outcome.description: Prognostic factors of death after developing intraabdominal hypertension and abdominal compartment syndrome

arm_group.description: All postoperative patients admitted to surgical ICU with foley catheter in place

intervention.description: Classic manometry technique measurement once daily

study_pop.textblock: All postoperative adult patients admitted to institutional surgical ICUs.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Postoperative patient admitted to surgical ICU
- Age >/= 18
- Foley's catheter in place
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient refusal
- Underwent neo-bladder procedure
- Need continuous bladder irrigation
